column5: Finally got out walter fishing for the first time this year.  Due to weddings on a long weekend and other arrangements i havent been out yet.  Last night my dad and i finally got out fishing and after a slow start with me waiting inside for him to pic me up and him sitting in my garage waiting for me to get home we finally left after 30 min of wondering where we each were, when we were actually there    :wallbash:  When we did get out the fishing wasn't hot but it was nice to get out. My dad got the first one coming in at 20 inches and finding the stringer.   After a lull i get my first hit and feels like it was a good one, but after telling my dad i think somethings wrong (had that feeling in my knees) the fish gets off. A moment later it hits again and smashes it this time, makeing sure it had the whole minnow.  After a good fight this old girl emerged, battle scars and all.  Tipping the scales at just over 7lbs.  This fish was thick....or so i thought   My dad got another 20 incher that ended up on stringer and after making a few moves with no luck we came back to the spot were we hit the first 3 fish and on the first drift...wham...another brute.  When i though my first fish was thick, this one topped it...another walter that hit 7lbs on the scale.  This fish is 1.5 inches smaller than my first.   Not bad for my first 2 walters of the year and both hogs. Will be tough to beat that, but ever nice to get out!
That's funny stuf man..  Looks like it was a fun time.  Nice Hogs too!

Thanks for posting, Love the Dad story  :D   and nice fish also Last night my dad and i finally got out fishing and after a slow start with me waiting inside for him to pic me up and him sitting in my garage waiting for me to get home we finally left after 30 min of wondering where we each were, when we were actually there. "Oh the memories"
Nice goin'! Definitely 2 quality fish.  What depth?
The last one was in about 6ft, the first was in 8-10.  My dads was in about 8-10 as well
nice eyes not another boat in sight
NIce fish! Man those fish are shallow compared to any walleye I get in the Ottawa River. The confusion sounds like a normal trip with my sons!  Dan O.
Very nice pickerel! Biggest ones I've seen so far this year!
Great story!  And a couple or great fish too! Nice to spend some quality time with the old man as well.
Great fish Anders, too funny 'bout you and your dad cursin each other's whereabouts.  definitely nice walters.  look forward to some more reports   cheers   Simon.
That is some funny stuff there, bet you laughed your arses off  Nice fish, chunky!!  Joey
